text:
<@U3N0GM3S7>  The version of blockchain-explorer that works with Fabric v0.6 is at <https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer> .  Do a *git clone <https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer> * and then follow the directions in *blockchain-explorer/explorer_1/README.md*.   

I followed the instructions in the Installation section and only had to make one deviation from them-  I was installing as root,  and *bower* did not like being installed as root until I performed this command:  ```echo '{ "allow_root": true }' > /root/.bowerrc``` as specified here:  <http://serverfault.com/questions/548537/cant-get-bower-working-bower-esudo-cannot-be-run-with-sudo> 

*Note:* I just ran the explorer natively on my OS and not in a Docker container so I didn't do the last step of building the hyperledger/blockchain-explorer Docker image, so I don't know if there are any pitfalls in that step.

attachments.title: Can't get bower working - bower ESUDO Cannot be run with sudo
attachments.text: I get the following error when I run bower:bower ESUDO Cannot be run with sudo Thing is, I'm not running bower with sudo. The command I run is:bower install foo or bower search cats I am l...
